channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Three Share Nobel in Economics for Work on How Technology Drives Growth
item.description: Joel Mokyr was awarded half of the prize, and Philippe Aghion and Peter Howitt shared the other half.

item.title: Who Are the Hostages Released From Captivity in Gaza?
item.description: Israel says 20 living hostages have been freed as part of a prisoner exchange. Here’s what we know about them.

item.title: Attorney General Letitia James to Headline Rally for Mamdani
item.description: In her first public appearance since she was indicted on a federal charge of bank fraud, Ms. James is expected to rebuke President Trump and make a ca...

item.title: Originalist ‘Bombshell’ Complicates Case on Trump’s Power to Fire Officials
item.description: As the Supreme Court seems poised to expand the president’s power, a leading scholar whose work the justices have often cited issued a provocative dis...

item.title: Dow futures jump nearly 400 points as markets eye another serving of the TACO trade after Trump says ‘Don’t worry about China’
item.description: "Highly respected President Xi just had a bad moment. He doesn’t want Depression for his country, and neither do I. The U.S.A. wants to help China, no...

item.title: What We Know About the Deal Between Israel and Hamas
item.description: Hostages in Gaza will be swapped for Palestinian prisoners in Israel. The last 20 living hostages were released on Monday morning.

item.title: Wall Street thinks China is winning Trump’s trade war
item.description: China holds an unexpectedly strong hand in the trade war, and the U.S.’s tariffs have been counterintuitively positive for China.

item.title: The immigration crackdown is ‘much, much worse’ for business than tariffs, some CEOs say
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: Live Updates: Trump Addresses Israeli Parliament as Hostages and Some Palestinian Prisoners Are Freed
item.description: President Trump arrived in Israel as Hamas released the last 20 living hostages in Gaza. Israel began releasing about 2,000 Palestinian prisoners as p...

item.title: Why Ukraine Is Betting on Strikes Deep Inside Russia
item.description: The Kremlin will only negotiate if missiles and drones bring the pain of war home to Russians, Ukrainian officials say.

item.title: Egypt Says Netanyahu Is Set to Attend Sharm el-Sheikh ‘Peace Summit’
item.description: Egypt’s president has billed the afternoon event as aimed at ending the war in Gaza. President Trump was expected to join alongside more than 20 world...

item.title: To Inflict Pain on Russians, Ukraine’s Drones Zero In on Oil Refineries
item.description: With Russian forces gaining slowly on the battlefield, Ukraine hopes its long-range drone campaign will help persuade Vladimir V. Putin to change cour...

item.title: Coal Miners With Black Lung Say They Are ‘Cast Aside to Die’ Under Trump
item.description: President Trump has been a cheerleader for coal miners. But these miners say his administration is failing to enforce limits on a lethal workplace haz...

item.title: Vance warns the longer the shutdown goes on, ‘the deeper the cuts are going to be’ as White House prepares to fire over 4,000 workers
item.description: “To be clear, some of these cuts are going to be painful. This is not a situation that we relish."

item.title: Trump warns Russia he may send Tomahawk missiles to Ukraine if war isn’t settled soon in ‘a new step of aggression’
item.description: “Do they want to have Tomahawks going in that direction? I don’t think so,” Trump said of Russia. “I think I might speak to Russia about that.”
